intro: Sciodaphyllum panamense, commonly known as the Panamanian sun-leaf, is a rare and unique plant native to the tropical regions of Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, large, and often brightly colored leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in the understory of dense forests. Its botanical features include a woody stem and palmate leaves that can reach several feet in diameter. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
